definitions.definition: a building in which films are shown

examples.text: The film has just opened in cinemas across the UK.
We were sitting in the cinema, waiting for the film to begin.
a screening at a cinema in Leicester Square in London
The cinema was packed every night for his latest film.
The cinema was packed, and we ended up sitting in the second row.
a multiplex cinema on the edge of town

definitions.definition: when you go to the cinema or to the movies, you go to a cinema to see a film

examples.text: I used to **go to the cinema** every week.
How often do you go to the cinema?
I haven't seen a film at the cinema for nearly 2 years.
Is there anything good on at the cinema at the moment?
I hated it when I saw it in the cinema.

definitions.definition: films as an art or an industry
definitions.labels: (especially British English)North American English usually(British English)(North American English)(British English)

examples.text: one of the great successes of British cinema
the most influential film in the history of cinema
He was honoured for his outstanding contribution to cinema.
She started making films in the last years of silent cinema.

wordOrigin: early 20th cent.: from French cinéma, abbreviation of cinématographe, from Greek kinēma, kinēmat- ‘movement’, from kinein ‘to move’.
